turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about West Ham United F.C. in European football.
turn.1: What happened in the 2001-2002 season to West Ham United?
turn.2: Bobby Moore, who had stated his desire to leave the club, was replaced as captain by Johnny Byrne.
turn.4: The West Germans won 2–1 at the Boleyn Ground.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Although Martin Peters scored first, Lothar Emmerich scored in the 86th and 87th minute to take a lead to the second leg in Dortmund.
turn.7: Did they win the second leg?
turn.8: On 13 April in West Germany, Dortmund scored in the first minute through Emmerich, who added another in the 28th minute and although Peters scored to make the game 2–4 on aggregate, Gerhard Cyliax scored a third Dortmund goal in the 87th minute to put them through to the final, 5–2 on aggregate.
turn.10: Winners of the 1975 FA Cup, West Ham – now managed by John Lyall – again entered the Cup Winners' Cup, eventually losing in the final to Anderlecht.
turn.11: What was the biggest game of the season?
turn.12: West Ham started this campaign with an away game against Finnish side, Lahden Reipas.
